lines.text: This can't be right. Let me see that map.

[to Stephen]
I offered you gold. 'Tis not my fault you prefer a pebble.

[Serving Stephen a mug of beer]
Here. Drag that over your tonsils.
How much do you want for Mr. Fitzgerald?
You needn't smile quite so cordially when you tip hat check girls. Gives them ideas.
Well, she gave me a couple.
Do you know the oldest and noblest occupation of them all?

[after an embarrassing pause]
I mean politics.
Well, you'll admit there are certain points of similarity.
I thought the traditional thing for leprechauns was a glass of milk.
You don't believe in the old superstitions?
I believe what my father knew and his father before him.
Well, you stay here in the car in case someone comes along, and I'll scout up the road a bit. Must lead somewhere.
Don't be sure. Irish paths are whimsical - like the Irish character.
